metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9772 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
OpenAFS 1.6.19 and earlier allows remote attackers to obtain sensitivedirectory information via vectors involving the (1) client cache partition,(2) fileserver vice partition, or (3) certain RPC responses.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9772` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libafsauthent2 - 1.6.20-1
libafsrpc2 - 1.6.20-1
libkopenafs2 - 1.6.20-1
openafs-client - 1.6.20-1
openafs-dbserver - 1.6.20-1
openafs-fileserver - 1.6.20-1
openafs-fuse - 1.6.20-1
openafs-krb5 - 1.6.20-1
openafs-modules-dkms - 1.6.20-1
openafs-modules-source - 1.6.20-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openafs package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.20-1').
